  • City: JACKSONVILLE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WENT TO DOOR #6 IN THE UNLOAD, WET PACKAGES WERE FOUND ON THE GRATING. ONE OF THE PACKAGES HAD A DIMAOND HAZMAT LABEL AND MULTI-PART HAZMAT PAPERS. TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGES TO THE HAZMAT AREA AND PROCESSED USING SODIUM BICARBONATE AND ZEP ZORBENT, WEARING GOOGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVERSHIELD AND NITRILE GLOVES.

item.title: Report E-2024090314
item.description:
Report E-2024090314

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NJV. It was reported that approximately half a gallon of TRANSCHEM Muriatic Acid released from a plastic jug due to improper loading. The release impacted inside of trailer #4653612. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed that 5-gallons of product was released impacting a 4' X 4' area of trailer floor and beneath the trailer. The contractor collected and containerized the TRANSCHEM Muriatic Acid and all clean-up debris into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024090296

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver failed to properly secure the loading lines at the shipper location. As a result, approximately 1300 pounds of molten sulfur was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024090264
item.description:
Report E-2024090264

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: HIALEAH LAKES
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XMI contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 55-gallon DF containing Organic Emitter Clean. A Contractor was dispatched and observed a 0.5-gallon release isolated to the top of the drum as a result of a puncture from a forklift blade. The drum was flipped over in attempt to stop the leak resulting in a product impact to the wooden trailer floor. The Contractor overpacked the damaged and leaking drum into a 95-gallon DF. XPO will manage waste disposal. The impact to the trailer floor evaporated by the time that the contractors attempted to clean it. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report E-2024080590
item.description:
Report E-2024080590

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: MULBERRY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 17, 2024, at 1400 hours, personnel in the CSXT Mulberry Yard discovered tank car TEIX 3132, loaded with Elevated Temperature Liquid, NOS (Asphalt) appeared to have product adhering to side of tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Vertex Energy, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024081700082). Hulls Environmental, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to inspect the car. Response personnel confirmed asphalt adhering to side and top of tank car, additionally it was noted that product had released due to an improperly secured manway cover. Specifically, 4 of the 8 manway cover swing bolts not applied; 4 of the 8 manway cover swing bolts were less than tool tight; and the manway cover gasket wis aligned. Contractor personnel inspected and reinstalled the gasket, and properly secured the manway cover for transportation. All hazardous product adhering to the exterior of the tank was removed. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative (Scott Ehrlich at 281-799-8576).
